items.title: Use GitHub Actions for CI
items.body:
- At least add automatic testing for the tip of the tree, consider adding testing of PRs as well.

- Investigate automatic releases to PyPI for tagged releases.

items.title: LC_NAMES table missing a few commands
items.body:
**[Original report](https://bitbucket.org/ronaldoussoren/macholib/issue/32) by Anonymous.**

----------------------------------------

The following commands are missing from the LC_NAMES table; This leads to `.get_cmd_name()` just returning the integer value instead of the string. Very minor :)

LC_ENCRYPTION_INFO_64 = 0x2c
LC_LINKER_OPTION = 0x2d
LC_PREPAGE

I validated everything from line 442 -> 479 in mach_o.py was inside of LC_NAMES and found only the three above where missing. 

Happy holidays to you!

items.title: New dyld load commands not handled (LC_DYLD_CHANGED_FIXUPS and LC_DYLD_EXPORTS_TRIE)
items.body:
**[Original report](https://bitbucket.org/ronaldoussoren/macholib/issue/31) by Anonymous.**

----------------------------------------

There are two new load commands added in 10.15 / iOS 13 (http://newosxbook.com/articles/13-10.15.html and can be seen in /Applications.Xcode.app/Contents/Developer/Platforms/MacOSX.platform/Developer/SDKs/MacOSX.sdk/usr/include/mach-o/loader.h:324

`#define LC_DYLD_EXPORTS_TRIE (0x33 | LC_REQ_DYLD) /* used with linkedit_data_command, payload is trie */`

`#define LC_DYLD_CHAINED_FIXUPS (0x34 | LC_REQ_DYLD) /* used with linkedit_data_command */`

This is blocking usage of macholib on any recent binary, [good time to reference issue #26](https://bitbucket.org/ronaldoussoren/macholib/issues/26/feature-option-for-ignoring-unknown-load)

I'm not yet sure of the extent or necessity of these new load commands.

items.title: macholib.__version__ is 1.10 in 1.11 tag
items.body:
**[Original report](https://bitbucket.org/ronaldoussoren/macholib/issue/28) by Anthony Foglia (Bitbucket: [afoglia](https://bitbucket.org/afoglia), GitHub: [afoglia](https://github.com/afoglia)).**

----------------------------------------

https://bitbucket.org/ronaldoussoren/macholib/src/5b454c3bc7dcf82368d542878b6e89e15e34371e/macholib/__init__.py?at=macholib-1.11&fileviewer=file-view-default

Looks like you missed bumping up the version number.

A bit annoying as I'm worried users of the version I'm introducing may get confused by the version number embedded in the module.

items.title: macho dump causes 'build_version_command' object has no attribute 'describe' error
items.body:
**[Original report](https://bitbucket.org/ronaldoussoren/macholib/issue/27) by Anonymous.**

----------------------------------------

When we run our dump command - the output fails with:

> 'build_version_command' object has no attribute 'describe'

To fix this I have manually added the following empty attribute to build_version_command in mach_o.py:

```
    def describe(self):
        return {}
```

items.title: python -mmacholib find error! in python3
items.body:
**[Original report](https://bitbucket.org/ronaldoussoren/macholib/issue/24) by Anonymous.**

----------------------------------------

in python3：

```
    path = '/Users/HTC/Documents/20180625521194/Payload/中国'
    cmd = "python -mmacholib find %s" % (path)
    out = subprocess.getstatusoutput(cmd)
```

error:
```
UnicodeDecodeError: 'ascii' codec can't decode byte 0xe6 in position 109: ordinal not in range(128)
```

help me!

items.title: Add help option with clean exit status
items.body:
**[Original report](https://bitbucket.org/ronaldoussoren/macholib/issue/23) by jakirkham (Bitbucket: [jakirkham](https://bitbucket.org/jakirkham), GitHub: [jakirkham](https://github.com/jakirkham)).**

----------------------------------------

It would be nice if a `help` or similar option were provided [here]( https://bitbucket.org/ronaldoussoren/macholib/src/53d85321baffbfd7d911572b5d37fbaa53056e5a/macholib/__main__.py?at=default&fileviewer=file-view-default#__main__.py-71 ), which exited with `0` instead of `1`.

items.title: license file
items.body:
**[Original report](https://bitbucket.org/ronaldoussoren/macholib/issue/22) by Dougal Sutherland (Bitbucket: [dougalsutherland](https://bitbucket.org/dougalsutherland), GitHub: [dougalsutherland](https://github.com/dougalsutherland)).**

----------------------------------------

Under the MIT license, you're supposed to include a copy of the license terms along with distributions of the code, but this package doesn't seem to have that (just `license: MIT` in `setup.cfg`). It'd make packagers' lives easier if you added a `LICENSE` file with [the license text](https://opensource.org/licenses/MIT), and added that to `MANIFEST.in` as well.

items.title: Add load commands in macholib/mach_o.py
items.body:
**[Original report](https://bitbucket.org/ronaldoussoren/macholib/issue/20) by Laurent DORE (Bitbucket: [ldore](https://bitbucket.org/ldore), GitHub: [ldore](https://github.com/ldore)).**

----------------------------------------

New Load commands have been added to the file:

http://llvm.org/docs/doxygen/html/Support_2MachO_8h_source.html

The file `macholib/mach_o.py` should be updated with the following values:

    LC_LINKER_OPTIMIZATION_HINT = 0x0000002E
    LC_VERSION_MIN_TVOS     = 0x0000002F
    LC_VERSION_MIN_WATCHOS  = 0x00000030

items.title: Can't codesign libraries in app bundle
items.body:
**[Original report](https://bitbucket.org/ronaldoussoren/macholib/issue/19) by Brendan Simon (Bitbucket: [BrendanSimon](https://bitbucket.org/BrendanSimon), GitHub: [BrendanSimon](https://github.com/BrendanSimon)).**

----------------------------------------

Codesign an app bundled and libraries within -- generated with py2app 0.9 -- fails. I am codesigning libraries and frameworks individually, then finally the top level application directory.

codesign complains about many libraries (dylibs). example: myapp/Contents/Frameworks/libncursesw.5.dylib

I tried codesigning libncursesw.5.dylib from the /Library directory and it succeeded, but the one that is in the app bundle fails, so my assumption is py2app is doing something to cause it to fail.

**Signing library in app bundle fails !!**

```
#!

$ codesign -s "Brendan Simon" -f -vvvv --signature-size=9400 dist/myapp.app/Contents/Frameworks/libncursesw.5.dylib
.../myapp.app/Contents/Frameworks/libncursesw.5.dylib malformed object (load command 3 cmdsize not a multiple of 8) dist/myapp.app/Contents/Frameworks/libncursesw.5.dylib: the codesign_allocate helper tool cannot be found or used

$ codesign -vvvv --signature-size=9400 dist/myapp.app/Contents/Frameworks/libncursesw.5.dylib dist/myapp.app/Contents/Frameworks/libncursesw.5.dylib: code object is not signed at all In architecture: x86_64

```

**Signing library from /Library succeeds !!**

```
#!

$ cp /Library/Frameworks/Python.framework/Versions/2.7/lib/libncursesw.5.dylib ~/tmp/

$ codesign -s "Brendan Simon" -f -vvvv --signature-size=9400 ~/tmp/libncursesw.5.dylib /Users/brendan/tmp/libncursesw.5.dylib: signed Mach-O universal (i386 x86_64) [libncursesw.5]

$ codesign -vvvv ~/tmp/libncursesw.5.dylib /Users/brendan/tmp/libncursesw.5.dylib: valid on disk /Users/brendan/tmp/libncursesw.5.dylib: satisfies its Designated Requirement

```

A similar thing happens with other executables and frameworks.

items.title: mach_version_helper incorrectly parsers version
items.body:
**[Original report](https://bitbucket.org/ronaldoussoren/macholib/issue/18) by Kentzo (Bitbucket: [Kentzo](https://bitbucket.org/Kentzo), GitHub: [Kentzo](https://github.com/Kentzo)).**

----------------------------------------

Major and minor are mixed up.

E.g. `otool -l` shows that current version is 1.0.0, but command retrieved via macholib shows that version is 0.1.0 (major is 0, minor is 1).

items.title: LC_LOAD_UPWARD_DYLIB should be in the _RELOCATABLE set
items.body:
**[Original report](https://bitbucket.org/ronaldoussoren/macholib/issue/17) by Anonymous.**

----------------------------------------

Without that, `walkRelocatables` ignores certain references.

items.title: dead loop
items.body:
**[Original report](https://bitbucket.org/ronaldoussoren/macholib/issue/16) by pianoboy sai (Bitbucket: [pianoboysai](https://bitbucket.org/pianoboysai), GitHub: [pianoboysai](https://github.com/pianoboysai)).**

----------------------------------------

it seems it's not a mach-o, but macholib goes into a dead loop.

items.title: MachOGraph.locate calls dyld_find with wrong parameter
items.body:
**[Original report](https://bitbucket.org/ronaldoussoren/macholib/issue/15) by Alex O'Donovan-Jones (Bitbucket: [aodj](https://bitbucket.org/aodj), GitHub: [aodj](https://github.com/aodj)).**

----------------------------------------

The changes made to `MachOGraph.py` in [this](https://bitbucket.org/ronaldoussoren/macholib/src/d0a2c8f69d52c7ecf7eb50128b39c0ffae73b03d/macholib/MachOGraph.py?at=default) commit, refer to the wrong parameter when calling `dyld_find`

```
#!python

fn = dyld_find(filename, env=self.env,
    executable_path=self.executable_path,
    loader=loader.filename)
```

The function doesn't accept a `loader` argument, but rather `loader_path`.
```
#!python
def dyld_find(name, executable_path=None, env=None, loader_path=None):
```

items.title: Can't pass endian argument to p_uint64.from_str
items.body:
**[Original report](https://bitbucket.org/ronaldoussoren/macholib/issue/14) by Asger Hautop Drewsen (Bitbucket: [tyilo](https://bitbucket.org/tyilo), GitHub: [tyilo](https://github.com/tyilo)).**

----------------------------------------

It looks like the MetaPackable's `from_str` method accepts an `_endian_` keyword argument:

```
#!python
def from_str(cls, s, **kw):
        endian = kw.get('_endian_', cls._endian_)
        return cls.from_tuple(struct.unpack(endian + cls._format_, s), **kw)
```

However it doesn't actually work:
```
#!python
macholib.ptypes.p_uint64.from_str('\x01\x00\x00\x00\x00\x00\x00\x00', _endian_='<')
```

Here is the exception I get from iPython:

```
TypeError                                 Traceback (most recent call last)
<ipython-input-25-8cdc68314575> in <module>()
----> 1 macholib.ptypes.p_uint64.from_str('\x01\x00\x00\x00\x00\x00\x00\x00', _endian_='<')

/Users/Tyilo/repos/macholib/macholib/ptypes.py in from_str(cls, s, **kw)
     65     def from_str(cls, s, **kw):
     66         endian = kw.get('_endian_', cls._endian_)
---> 67         return cls.from_tuple(struct.unpack(endian + cls._format_, s), **kw)
     68
     69     def from_tuple(cls, tpl, **kw):

/Users/Tyilo/repos/macholib/macholib/ptypes.py in from_tuple(cls, tpl, **kw)
     68
     69     def from_tuple(cls, tpl, **kw):
---> 70         return cls(tpl[0], **kw)
     71
     72 class BasePackable(object):

TypeError: '_endian_' is an invalid keyword argument for this function
```

items.title: MachO fails to parse 10.8 64-bit Python3 modules
items.body:
**[Original report](https://bitbucket.org/ronaldoussoren/macholib/issue/10) by Andrew Barnert (Bitbucket: [abarnert](https://bitbucket.org/abarnert), GitHub: [abarnert](https://github.com/abarnert)).**

----------------------------------------

The simplest repeatable test case I've got:

On a 10.8.2 machine, use Homebrew to install python3 version 3.2.3, then pip-3.2 install appscript, and build the latest macholib. Then:

    
    #!python
    >>> import macholib.MachO
    >>> import aem
    >>> macholib.MachO.MachO(aem.ae.__file__)
    
    Traceback (most recent call last):
      File "<stdin>", line 1, in <module>
      File "/usr/local/Cellar/python3/3.2.3/Frameworks/Python.framework/Versions/3.2/lib/python3.2/site-packages/macholib/MachO.py", line 69, in __init__
        self.load(fp)
      File "/usr/local/Cellar/python3/3.2.3/Frameworks/Python.framework/Versions/3.2/lib/python3.2/site-packages/macholib/MachO.py", line 84, in load
        self.load_header(fh, 0, size)
      File "/usr/local/Cellar/python3/3.2.3/Frameworks/Python.framework/Versions/3.2/lib/python3.2/site-packages/macholib/MachO.py", line 114, in load_header
        hdr = MachOHeader(self, fh, offset, size, magic, hdr, endian)
      File "/usr/local/Cellar/python3/3.2.3/Frameworks/Python.framework/Versions/3.2/lib/python3.2/site-packages/macholib/MachO.py", line 154, in __init__
        self.load(fh)
      File "/usr/local/Cellar/python3/3.2.3/Frameworks/Python.framework/Versions/3.2/lib/python3.2/site-packages/macholib/MachO.py", line 233, in load
        cmd_data = fh.read(data_size)
      File "/usr/local/Cellar/python3/3.2.3/Frameworks/Python.framework/Versions/3.2/lib/python3.2/site-packages/macholib/util.py", line 100, in read
        raise ValueError("Invalid size %s while reading from %s", size, self._fileobj)
    ValueError: ('Invalid size %s while reading from %s', -8, <_io.BufferedReader name='/usr/local/Cellar/python3/3.2.3/Frameworks/Python.framework/Versions/3.2/lib/python3.2/site-packages/aeosa/aem/ae.so'>)
    

The same problem happens in Python 2, as long as you're inspecting a Python 3 .so:
    
    #!python
    >>> import macholib.MachO
    >>> macholib.MachO.MachO('/usr/local/Cellar/python3/3.2.3/Frameworks/Python.framework/Versions/3.2/lib/python3.2/site-packages/aeosa/aem/ae.so')
    Traceback (most recent call last):
      File "<stdin>", line 1, in <module>
      File "/Library/Python/2.7/site-packages/macholib/MachO.py", line 69, in __init__
        self.load(fp)
      File "/Library/Python/2.7/site-packages/macholib/MachO.py", line 84, in load
        self.load_header(fh, 0, size)
      File "/Library/Python/2.7/site-packages/macholib/MachO.py", line 114, in load_header
        hdr = MachOHeader(self, fh, offset, size, magic, hdr, endian)
      File "/Library/Python/2.7/site-packages/macholib/MachO.py", line 154, in __init__
        self.load(fh)
      File "/Library/Python/2.7/site-packages/macholib/MachO.py", line 233, in load
        cmd_data = fh.read(data_size)
      File "/Library/Python/2.7/site-packages/macholib/util.py", line 100, in read
        raise ValueError("Invalid size %s while reading from %s", size, self._fileobj)
    ValueError: ('Invalid size %s while reading from %s', -8L, <closed file '/usr/local/Cellar/python3/3.2.3/Frameworks/Python.framework/Versions/3.2/lib/python3.2/site-packages/aeosa/aem/ae.so', mode 'rb' at 0x108c438a0>)
    

Doing the same thing, in either Python 2 or 3, against the Python 2 aem.ae.so seems to work fine.

I've seen the same thing with one of my three custom modules, and at least one other third-party module, but others work fine.

It doesn't seem to matter whether macholib is built or runs on 10.7 vs. 10.8, but it may matter whether the so it's dealing with was built on 10.7 vs. 10.8 (I haven't tested enough to be sure).

items.title: Alignment issue when rewriting data sections
items.body:
**[Original report](https://bitbucket.org/ronaldoussoren/macholib/issue/9) by Brian Pescatore (Bitbucket: [bpescatore](https://bitbucket.org/bpescatore), ).**

----------------------------------------

I believe the issue is at line 295 in MachO.py:
    
    #!python
    data = data + (b'\x00' * (align - (len(data) % align)))
    

I called rewriteDataForCommand with the index of an LC_LOAD_DYLINKER command and the exact same dylinker (/usr/bin/dyld).  The overall size of the given load_command went from the original 32 bytes (as generated by ld on OSX) down to 28 bytes.

Now, I am not certain about this, but I believe the alignment needs to apply to both the header and data, suggesting that the line should instead be this:
    
    #!python
    data = data + (b'\x00' * (align - ( (len(data) + hdrsize) % align)))
    

If I am wrong about this, please let me know--it will certainly clear up my confusion.

items.title: Unlisted dependency
items.body:
**[Original report](https://bitbucket.org/ronaldoussoren/macholib/issue/8) by Anonymous.**

----------------------------------------

This package requires "modulegraph" to be installed, otherwise it the import on line 11 of util.py will raise an Exception.

Perhaps add it as an another line in 'require'.

I was able to replicate this behavior by running:
import macholib.MachO

items.title: Failed to parse iPhone binary (Mach-O executable acorn)
items.body:
**[Original report](https://bitbucket.org/ronaldoussoren/macholib/issue/6) by Anonymous.**

----------------------------------------

Hi,

macholib-1.4.2 failed to parse header of iPhone binary. Log below:
    
    macholib-1.4.2/macholib$ file sambactl 
    sambactl: Mach-O executable acorn
    
    macholib-1.4.2/macholib$ python macho_dump.py sambactl 
    sambactl
    Traceback (most recent call last):
      File "macho_dump.py", line 38, in <module>
        sys.exit(main(print_file))
      File "/usr/local/lib/python2.6/dist-packages/macholib-1.4.2-py2.6.egg/macholib/_cmdline.py", line 41, in main
        err |= check_file(sys.stdout, base, callback)
      File "/usr/local/lib/python2.6/dist-packages/macholib-1.4.2-py2.6.egg/macholib/_cmdline.py", line 23, in check_file
        callback(fp, path)
      File "macho_dump.py", line 19, in print_file
        m = MachO(path)
      File "/usr/local/lib/python2.6/dist-packages/macholib-1.4.2-py2.6.egg/macholib/MachO.py", line 67, in __init__
        self.load(open(filename, 'rb'))
      File "/usr/local/lib/python2.6/dist-packages/macholib-1.4.2-py2.6.egg/macholib/MachO.py", line 82, in load
        self.load_header(fh, 0, size)
      File "/usr/local/lib/python2.6/dist-packages/macholib-1.4.2-py2.6.egg/macholib/MachO.py", line 112, in load_header
        hdr = MachOHeader(self, fh, offset, size, magic, hdr, endian)
      File "/usr/local/lib/python2.6/dist-packages/macholib-1.4.2-py2.6.egg/macholib/MachO.py", line 152, in __init__
        self.load(fh)
      File "/usr/local/lib/python2.6/dist-packages/macholib-1.4.2-py2.6.egg/macholib/MachO.py", line 231, in load
        cmd_data = fh.read(data_size)
      File "/usr/local/lib/python2.6/dist-packages/macholib-1.4.2-py2.6.egg/macholib/util.py", line 97, in read
        assert size >= 0
    AssertionError

items.title: Mach-O headers on Mac OS X Lion are not parsed correctly (py2app)
items.body:
**[Original report](https://bitbucket.org/ronaldoussoren/macholib/issue/5) by Anonymous.**

----------------------------------------

Summary:

py2app fails in Python macholib module on Mac OS X Lion (10.7) Developer Preview 2 with update applied (11A430e).

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Try to create a standalone Mac OS X application with Python (py2app) using an example code. You can use any Python app from  standard PyObjC site in http://pyobjc.sourceforge.net/examples/

2. Issue

//   python setup.py py2app //

command in Terminal.

Expected Results:

Command is executed with no error result.

Actual Results:

Python listing ends with the following problem:


copying /System/Library/Frameworks/Python.framework/Versions/2.7/lib/python2.7/config/Makefile -> /Users/myuser/Desktop/py/pyobjc/pyobjc-framework-CalendarStore/Examples/Coding Headstart/dist/PyCalendarStore.app/Contents/Frameworks/Python.framework/Versions/2.7/lib/python2.7/config

Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/System/Library/Frameworks/Python.framework/Versions/2.7/Extras/lib/python/py2app/build_app.py", line 604, in _run
    self.run_normal()

  File "/System/Library/Frameworks/Python.framework/Versions/2.7/Extras/lib/python/py2app/build_app.py", line 687, in run_normal
    self.create_binaries(py_files, pkgdirs, extensions, loader_files)

  File "/System/Library/Frameworks/Python.framework/Versions/2.7/Extras/lib/python/py2app/build_app.py", line 823, in create_binaries
    platfiles = mm.run()

  File "/System/Library/Frameworks/Python.framework/Versions/2.7/Extras/lib/python/macholib/MachOStandalone.py", line 102, in run
    mm.run_file(fn)

  File "/System/Library/Frameworks/Python.framework/Versions/2.7/Extras/lib/python/macholib/MachOGraph.py", line 69, in run_file
    m = self.createNode(MachO, pathname)

  File "/System/Library/Frameworks/Python.framework/Versions/2.7/Extras/lib/python/macholib/MachOStandalone.py", line 23, in createNode
    res = super(FilteredMachOGraph, self).createNode(cls, name)

  File "/System/Library/Frameworks/Python.framework/Versions/2.7/Extras/lib/python/altgraph/ObjectGraph.py", line 148, in createNode
    m = cls(name, *args, **kw)

  File "/System/Library/Frameworks/Python.framework/Versions/2.7/Extras/lib/python/macholib/MachO.py", line 69, in __init__
    self.load(open(filename, 'rb'))

  File "/System/Library/Frameworks/Python.framework/Versions/2.7/Extras/lib/python/macholib/MachO.py", line 79, in load
    self.load_fat(fh)

  File "/System/Library/Frameworks/Python.framework/Versions/2.7/Extras/lib/python/macholib/MachO.py", line 90, in load_fat
    self.load_header(fh, arch.offset, arch.size)

  File "/System/Library/Frameworks/Python.framework/Versions/2.7/Extras/lib/python/macholib/MachO.py", line 114, in load_header
    hdr = MachOHeader(self, fh, offset, size, magic, hdr, endian)

  File "/System/Library/Frameworks/Python.framework/Versions/2.7/Extras/lib/python/macholib/MachO.py", line 154, in __init__
    self.load(fh)

  File "/System/Library/Frameworks/Python.framework/Versions/2.7/Extras/lib/python/macholib/MachO.py", line 186, in load
    raise ValueError("Unknown load command: %d" % (cmd_load.cmd,))

ValueError: Unknown load command: 36

> /System/Library/Frameworks/Python.framework/Versions/2.7/Extras/lib/python/macholib/MachO.py(186)load()
-> raise ValueError("Unknown load command: %d" % (cmd_load.cmd,))

items.title: error: doc/changelog.rst: No such file or directory
items.body:
**[Original report](https://bitbucket.org/ronaldoussoren/macholib/issue/1) by Anonymous.**

----------------------------------------

Hi guys,

I am only a beginner at python but i was trying to install py2app to use and i came across this error:


Processing altgraph-0.7.1.tar.gz
Running altgraph-0.7.1/setup.py -q bdist_egg --dist-dir /tmp/easy_install-gcCblA/altgraph-0.7.1/egg-dist-tmp-Bve00P
error: doc/changelog.rst: No such file or directory

Did it install properly and if not what do i do to get around this?

Thanks,
  Francis
